intro: Codonoboea anthonyi, commonly known as Anthony's codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
